Objective: \textbf{Objective 1:} Research the links between urbanisation trends, and resource management challenges and opportunities to motivate the thesis.

\textbf{Objective 2(a):} Research the urban metabolism concept which provides a theoretical framework to assess urban resource consumption. \newline \textbf{Objective 2(b):} Research modelling methods used currently in designing for sustainable resource management.
Contribution to thesis: Locate this research question within the existing literature.
Contribution to the field: Identify theoretical and methodological opportunities and gaps in the literature and so advance the UM framework providing a new way to conceptualise the way a city relates to its resource flows.

Objective: \textbf{Objective 3:} Determine metrics to quantify performance of multi-resource systems, appropriate to measure the success at meeting environmental and economic challenges.
Contribution to thesis: Propose the theory which can be used to assess an area's metabolism (and so assess the results of modelling).
Contribution to the field: Determine metrics appropriate to quantify the performance of an area's metabolism (work published in \citet{Ravalde2015a}).

Objective: \textbf{Objective 4:} Systematically research the processes likely to influence urban metabolism between now and 2030 (to provide model inputs).
Contribution to thesis: Assemble data for use in the model.
Contribution to the field: Assemble an open-source database of the resource management processes over the coming years (work published in \citet{Ravalde2016}).

Objective: \textbf{Objective 5:} Develop the mathematical formulation and the computational implementation of the model.
Contribution to the field: Development of the model using a benchmark test case which others can use as a starting point to further develop the model.

Objective: \textbf{Objective 6:} Apply the model to a case study to demonstrate resource integration.
Contribution to thesis: Apply the model to a case study.
Contribution to the field: Demonstration of model to show how it might be employed by decision makers. (Early version of this work published in \citet{Ravalde2015}.)

Objective: \textbf{Objective 7:} Evaluate the success and implications of the model.
Contribution to thesis: Answer the research question, and propose an agenda for future research.
